recipe_long_name: Jowar Bhakri recipe - How to make Jowar Bhakri
ingredients:
1 cup jowar (white millet) flour
 salt to taste
 jowar (white millet) flour for rolling
recipe:
Method
Combine the jowar flour and salt in a bowl, mix well and knead into a smooth stiff dough, using enough hot water.
Divide the dough into 3-4 equal portions.
Roll out each portion, using little flour for rolling into a circle of 5" diameter to make a semi-thick roti.
Heat a tava and cook the bhakri applying little water to the upper surface and spread it all over with the help of your fingers.
Cook the bhakri on other side and when the water evaporates,  cook for a minute
Now roast the bhakri on direct flame from both the sides.
Serve hot.
tags: Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Thalipith recipe - How to make Thalipith
ingredients:
1 tbsp whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1 tbsp maize flour (makai ka atta) (coarse)
 1 tbsp rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 2 tbsp chopped onions
 1 tsp  each of spinach (palak) , spring onions , fenugreek (methi) and tomatoes, all finely chopped
 1 tsp boiled green peas
 1 boiled and mashed potato
 1 tsp grated carrot
 1 tsp grated beetroot
 1 tsp finely chopped green chillies
 1 tsp red chilli
 1 tsp garam masala
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tbsp butter or oil
 1 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
recipe:
Mix all flours and dry rost for 5 minutes. allow to cool to room temperature. 
Mix all the spices and vegetables. 
Add 1 tbsp of oil and make a soft dough by adding water. 
Divide the dough into equal parts. roll one part with hand or rollpin into small rounds. 
Heat pan and grease it with some oil. place the thalipith on the greased pan and cover for 3 minutes. cook both side until glden brown and crispy. apply butter while cooking. 
Serve hot with curd or unsalted butter. it tastes very good.
tags: Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
times: Preparation Time: 20 min, Cooking Time: 20 min, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Rasavangi recipe - How to make Rasavangi
ingredients:
4 medium sized brinjals (baingan / eggplant)
 2 cups toovar (arhar) dal
 1 1/2 tsp chana dal (split Bengal gram)
 2 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds
 7 red chillies
 1  small cup coconut
 1 1/2 tsp urad dal (split black lentils)
 a pinch asafoetida (hing)
 oil
 a piece of tamarind (imli)
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
recipe:
Roast chana dal, coriander seeds, chilli, coconut in very little oil to red and grind to a fine powder.
Roast brinjal to medium in a vessel.
Pour the tamarind extract and add salt, turmeric, asafoetida and let it boil.
Add 2 cups of water.
When they are tender, add the pressure cooked toor dal and boil full.
Add the powder and put off flame and serve.
tags: Maharashtrian Bhaji
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 25 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Tasty Thalipeeth recipe - How to make Tasty Thalipeeth
ingredients:
1 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 cup bajra (black millet) flour
 1 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 2 tsp grated ginger (adrak)
 1 tbsp green chilli paste
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 3 tbsp coriander (dhania) seeds powder
 1 tbsp garlic (lehsun) paste
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 small onion , finely chopped
 salt to taste
 3 tsp oil for greasing
recipe:
Method
Mix all the flours together and roast them for 5 minutes or till you smell the aroma.
All all other ingredients to the flour and knead the dough tightly, using little water.
Divide the dough in 6 equal portions.
Roll out each portion into a thick rotis using a rolling pin.
Grease the non-stick pan with the oil and cook the thalipeeth till it is crispy on both sides.
Serve hot.
tags:
Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
Indian Tawa
Quick Rotis / Parathas
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Faraali Dahi Wade recipe - How to make Faraali Dahi Wade
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups sanwa millet (sama)
 1/3 cup water
 2 to 3 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 2 to 3 tsp roasted powdered peanuts
 2 medium boiled potatoes , mashed
 salt to taste
 1 tsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 oil for deep frying
 3 cups curds (dahi)
 pinch red chilli powder
 pinch roasted cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 pinch black salt (sanchal)
 pinch freshly ground black pepper powder
recipe:
Method
Wash the sanwa millet and transfer in a small deep pan.
Add water and cover the vessel with the lid and pressure cook for 3-4 whistles.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Cool and transfer the sanwa in a bowl.
Add the ginger-green chilli paste, salt, groundnut powder, potato mash, coriander and mix gently till mixed well.
Heat the oil in a kadhai.
Make small flat wadas of the mixture and deep fry in oil till they turn golden brown and crisp form all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and keep aside.
Dip the wads in warm water for 2 minutes.
Now in a Serving bowl take 3-4 balls softly press to remove the water.
Then just pour the sweet or sour curd sprinkle black salt, black pepper powder and roasted cumin seed powder and its all ready to serve.
You can have these wades just with green spicy chutney or cucumber raita.
tags: Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Cluster Beans Chutney recipe - How to make Cluster Beans Chutney
ingredients:
10 to 12 cluster beans (gavarfali)
 2 small green chillies
 1 tbsp roasted powdered peanuts
 salt to taste
 1 tsp lemon juice
 2 tsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 tsp oil
 For The Tempering:
 2 tsp oil
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 a pinch asafoetida (hing)
recipe:
Method
Take a kadhai put oil in it when oil is hot put cluster beans (cut into small pieces) and green chillies and saute for 2 to 3 minutes stirring continuously.
Then add half cup of water and cook for 5 minutes on medium heat stirring occasionally or until soft.
Then add groundnut powder, salt and mix well.
Take a small pan and heat oil and add the mustard seeds and asafoetida.
Put this tadka on above chutney. Serve with almost any dish.
tags:
Maharashtrian Chutneys, Maharashtrian Pickles
Quick Chutneys
times: Preparation Time: 15  mins, Cooking Time: 15  mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Mix Sprouts Puranpoli recipe - How to make Mix Sprouts Puranpoli
ingredients:
1/2 cup sprouted moong (whole green gram)
 1/2 cup sprouted matki (moath beans)
 1/2 cup sprouted hara vatana (dried green peas)
 2 boiled potatoes
 2 tbsp oil
 1 cup plain flour (maida)
 1 cup jaggery (gur)
 1 pinch of cardamom (elaichi) powder
 1 pinch of nutmeg (jaiphal)
 1/2 cup ghee for frying
recipe:
Method
Heat the ghee in a pan, add the sprouts and mash potatoes and saute till they turn pink in colour.
Add the jaggery, mix well and saute till the jaggery dissolves. Keep aside.
Combine the maida and 2 tbsp oil in a bowl, mix well and knead into a soft dough, using water.
Divide the dough into equal portions and roll them into small circles of 4" diameter.
Place a portion of the stuffing at the centro and seal the edges to make a puran and roll gain to a circle of 5" diameter.
Heat a tava and cook each puran using little ghee till golden brown spots appear on both the sides.
Serve hot.
tags: Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Techa (  Maharashtrian Recipe ) recipe - How to make Techa (  Maharashtrian Recipe )
ingredients:
10 green chillies
 5  flakes of garlic (lehsun)
 1 small bunch of coriander (dhania) leaves
 100 gms roasted peanuts
 1 lemon
 salt to taste
recipe:
Grind together all the above ingredients except the groundnuts. keep aside.
Grind the roasted groundnuts seperately.
Mix the groundnut powder  to the above mixture and squeeze the juice of a lime and add salt.
Your techa is ready to be served.
tags: Maharashtrian Bhaji
times: Preparation Time: 5 minutes, Cooking Time: nil, Total Time: 5 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sabudana Khichdi  By shubaraj recipe - How to make Sabudana Khichdi  By shubaraj
ingredients:
2 cups sago (sabudana)
 1/4 cup grated coconut
 1/2 cup powdered peanuts
 2 green chillies, chopped
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 potato , cut into cubes
 1 tbsp ghee
 salt to taste
recipe:
Wash, drain and soak the sabudana in water for ½ an hour.
Heat ghee in a vessel, add the jeera & chilies, when it starts spluttering add the potatoes and fry further.
Next add the salt, peanut powder and fry for a while.
Lastly add the soaked sabudana into the potato mixture and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with grated coconut.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
collection of khichdi recipes

Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat

recipe_long_name: Thalipeeth recipe - How to make Thalipeeth
ingredients:
3 tbsp besan (Bengal gram flour)
 3 tbsp jowar (white millet) flour
 3 tbsp whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1  small onion, chopped
 1 tomato , chopped
 4 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 3 green chillies, finely chopped
 salt to taste
 oil for cooking
recipe:
Mix together all the ingredients in a bowl and add enough water to make a thick batter. 
Heat and grease a non-stick tava. spread a layer of the batter to form a pancake . cook on both sides till golden brown, using a little oil. repeat to make 3 more thalipeeth. serve hot with home-made white butter.
tags:
Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
Quick Indian recipes for Kids
Snack Recipes for Kids
times: Preparation Time: 10min, Cooking Time: 10min, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Shahi Bread Kachori recipe - How to make Shahi Bread Kachori
ingredients:
10 to 12 bread slices
 200 gms grated mava (khoya)
 2 tbsp powdered sugar
 1 tsp cardamom powder
 1 tbsp dessicated coconut
 10-15 chopped almonds (badam)
 10 to 15 raisins (kismis)
 2 tsp ghee
 ghee for frying
 2 tbsp semolina (rava)
recipe:
Method
Place the mava on a pan and saute on a slow flame till they turm light brown.
Add the coconut powder, almonds and raisins and mix well.
Add the sugar and mix well.
Take a slice of bread and deep in water, place it on your palm and remove extra water.
Place mawa mixture on it and fold the bread slice carefully to make a round or roll or shape of tikki.
Place it in rawa plate and roll them evenly from all the sides.
Heat the ghee in a kadhai and deep fry till they turn golden brown from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot.
tags:
Punjabi Sweets
Maharashtrian Sweet Dishes
Traditional Indian Mithai

Cocktail Party
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sweet Coconut Modak recipe - How to make Sweet Coconut Modak
ingredients:
For The Covering:
 1 1/2 cups rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 1/4 tsp salt
 1/2 tsp butter
 For The Stuffing:
 1/2 cup grated coconut
 3/4 cup jaggery (gur)
 1 pinch of cardamom (elaichi) powder
recipe:
Method
Boil 1 1/4 cups water in a deep pan, add the salt and 1/2 tsp ghee, mix well and bring to boil.
Add the rice flour, mix well and remove from the flame.
Cover and keep aside for 12-15 minutes.
Knead into a soft dough with greased hands and keep aside.
For the stuffing
Combine the coconut and jaggery in a pan, mix well and saute till the jaggery dissolves and coconut turns golden brown.
Add the cardamom powder, mix well and remove from the flame and cool.
How to proceed
Divide the dough into equal portions and shape a portion into a shape of circle using greased palms.
Stuff a portion of the coconut stuffing and form plates with light finger and then fold it together into a modak shape.
Steam the modak in a steamer for 10-12 minutes.
Serve hot with desi ghee.
tags:
Maharashtrian Sweet Dishes
 different kinds of sheera
Peda, Ladoo collection
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Tilachi Poli recipe - How to make Tilachi Poli
ingredients:
2 cups whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 water as required
 2 cups toasted sesame seeds (til)
 2 1/4 cups grated jaggery (gur)
 1/4 cup roasted and crushed peanuts
recipe:
Method
Combine the sesame seeds, peanuts and jaggery and blend in a mixer till they become smooth and soft.
Make the soft dough using wheat flour and required water and keep aside for 15-20 minutes.
Make 5-6 equal portions of the dough then roll into a small circle of 3" diameter.
Put a small portion of above stuffing in the middle, close it by bringing all the edges into the middle and roll again into a normal chapati size(5") siameter.
Heat a tava and roast the poli on both the sides till light brown in colour using a little ghee.
Serve hot.

Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis

recipe_long_name: Masoor Bhaat recipe - How to make Masoor Bhaat
ingredients:
250 gms soaked masoor (whole red lentil)
 250 gms rice (chawal)
 250 gms tomatoes
 200 gms onions
 2 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 1 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp chilli powder
 2 tsp garam masala
 2 bayleaf (tejpatta)
 2 cloves (laung / lavang)
 4 to 5 curry leaves (kadi patta)
recipe:
Method
Boil the rice in a deep pan in enough water till cooked.
Keep aside.
Heat the oil in pan and add the bayleaf, cloves, red chilli and curry leaves and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the onions and saute till they turn golden brown.
Add the tomatoes, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt and garam masala, mix well and saute till the tomatoes turn soft and are pureed.
Add the massor and enough water, mix well and cook till the rice and masoor are cooked.
Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Crispy Sabudana Vada recipe - How to make Crispy Sabudana Vada
ingredients:
1/4 cup sago (sabudana) soaked in little water for 2 hours
 1 cup coarsely powdered roasted peanuts
 1 cup finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tbsp oil
 3 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 a few curry leaves (kadi patta)
 salt to taste
 oil for frying
recipe:
Method
Clean and wash the saav and keep aside.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and immediately add the washed saav to it and 3 cups of water and mix well.
Add the salt, mix well and cook till the water gets dried up.
Remove from the flame, add the sabudana, coarsely grinded peanuts, coriander, ginger and chilli paste and mix well.
Divide the mixture into 24 equal portions and roll it into circles and press it flat.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fryrn golden brown and crisp.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot with green and sweet red chutney.
tags: Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Rava Bhakri recipe - How to make Rava Bhakri
ingredients:
2  medium sized bowls semolina (rava)
 1  bowl of freshly grated coconut
 1  " piece of ginger (adrak), chopped
 4 green chillies, chopped
 1 tsp sugar
 salt to taste
 ghee to fry
recipe:
Clean rava first.  in a bow take grated cocunut, ginger, chillies, salt, sugar and smash properly, add rava in to it and make a batal of it.
Keep a frying pan  on a flame and greese with ghee and once heated take little mixture and spread on the  pan and fry until golden fry.
Serve hot with chatni or sauce.
tags:
Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
Jain Rotis, Jain Parathas
Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
Indian Tawa
times: Cooking Time: 10, Total Time: 10 mins , Preparation Time: 05 mts

recipe_long_name: Cucumber poha recipe - How to make Cucumber poha
ingredients:
thin beaten rice(poha) 3 cups
finely chopped green chillies 4 to 6
grated cucumber one cup or slightly more
grated coconut two tabel spoon
finely chopped corienda one table spoon
lime juice to taste
salt to taste
little sugar or sugar free to taste
recipe: Mix every thing in a large bowl and serve immediatly
tags: Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
times: Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 0 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sweet coconut poha - janmashtami special recipe - How to make Sweet coconut poha - janmashtami special
ingredients:
Poha- 2 Cups
Jaggery/Gud-1.5 Cup (broken in to small pieces)
Freshly Grated coconut-1.5 Cup
Ghee- 2 Tablespoon
Saffron- Few strands
Milk – to dissolve saffron
Cashewnut-10 (broken)
Cardamom powder- a pinch
recipe:
Clean and wash poha thoroughly
Soak poha in enough water to cover for 25-30 minutes. drain and leave in the stainer and keep aside.
In a deep pan heat ghee and fry the cashewnuts.
To this add coconut, jaggery, saffron and cardamom powder.
Keep mixing till all the jaggery gets melted and the mixture turns golden brown.
Now simmer the stove and add the pre-soaked poha
Mix thoroughly and keep it for 5 minutes and then remove the pan from heat.
Sweet coconut poha is ready.
tags: Maharashtrian Sweet Dishes
times: Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 0 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Chocolate Modak recipe - How to make Chocolate Modak
ingredients:
1/2 cup chopped dark chocolate
 3 tbsp condensed milk
 1 cup crushed digestive marie biscuits
 1/4 cup milk
 To Garnish:
 2 tbsp grated chocolate
recipe:
Method
Heat a non-stick pan, add the milk, condensed milk and chocolate and mix well till smooth.
Remove from the flame and keep aside to cool.
Add powdered biscuit and make a smooth dough.
Keep in fridge for 5 minutes.
Remove and mould it into modak shape using modak mould.
Sprinkle chocolate vermicelli on it and serve fresh and soft.
tags: Maharashtrian Sweet Dishes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Chirote recipe - How to make Chirote
ingredients:
3/4 cup plain flour (maida)
 1/4 cup semolina (rava)
 1 tbsp hot ghee
 a pinch of salt
 1/4 cup milk
 3 to 4 tbsp ghee , melted
 2 to 3 tbsp cornflour
 ghee or oil for deep frying
 1 cup sugar
 3 to 4 tbsp water
recipe:
Method
Take rava and maida into a bowl.
Add 1 tbsp hot ghee, a pinch of salt and mix with a spoon.
Add milk and knead to a medium consistency dough.
Keep it covered for 20 minutes.
Divide the dough into 6 equal portions, take 3 portions and keep the remaining portions covered.
Roll each portion into a paper-thin roti. (Try not to use any dry flour while rolling)
Combine the melted ghee and corn flour together and make a medium consistency paste which will be easy to spread.
On a flat surface take 1 rolled roti, spread 1 tbsp ghee-flour paste evenly.
Place the second roti on top of first roti, spread 1 tbsp paste and cover it with third roti and then spread some paste on top.
Roll the two opposite sides and make sure they will meet at the center.
Put one rolled portion on top of the other and gently press and let it stay in the open air for few minutes (till ghee in the layers solidifies).
Now prepare the other roll by using remaining 3 portions of dough.
Meanwhile, bring the sugar and water to a boil.
Make soft ball consistency sugar syrup. Turn off the heat.
When both rolls become little hard, heat ghee in kadai and cut the roll into 1 inch pieces.
Take one piece and keep the layered side facing up (vertically). Press it gently and roll with a rolling pin.
Make around 2.5 inch disc. Likewise make few of them and deep fry over low heat. Turn the sides occasionally to cook evenly.
Stand each fried chirota into a steel sifter (chhalni) to drip out excessive ghee.
When the chirota cools down a bit and is warm then dip it into sugar syrup and leave it for a minute and again stand it into the steel sifter.
Keep each chirota separate.
Likewise, make all the chirotas.
tags:
Maharashtrian Sweet Dishes
Traditional Indian Mithai
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Veg Nutritious Thalipeeth recipe - How to make Veg Nutritious Thalipeeth
ingredients:
1/4 cup jowar (white millet) flour
 1/4 cup bajra (black millet) flour
 2 tbsp besan (bengal gram flour)
 2 tbsp whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 2 tbsp ragi (nachni / red millet) flour
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
 1 small onion , finely chopped
 2 piches of turmeric powder (haldi)
 chilli powder to taste
 2 tbsp oil
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients with little water and knead into a soft dough.
Divide the dough in 6 equal portions.
Roll out the thalipeeth between two sheets of plastic into a circle 5” diameter, can be slightly thick.
Heat the tava, grease lightly with oil.
Cook the thalipeeth on both the sides using little oil till it brown spots appear.
Serve hot with butter or masala curd.
tags: Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Faraali Khichdi recipe - How to make Faraali Khichdi
ingredients:
100 gms sanwa millet (sama)
 2 tbsp ghee
 5 to 6 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 to 2 finely chopped green chillies
 250 gms bottle gourd (doodhi / lauki)
 1/4 cup crushed peanuts
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Peel and grate the dudhi and keep it aside.
Slightly roast the sanwa miller on a slow flame and keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a pan, add the peanuts and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the cumin seeds, green chillies and curry leaves and saute for 1 minutes.
Add the bottle gourd and remaining ingredients, mix well and cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
tags:
Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
One Dish Vegetarian Meals
One Meal Dinner
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Khichdi  By Envyvan recipe - How to make Khichdi  By Envyvan
ingredients:
2 cups rice (chawal)
 3/4 cup yellow moong dal (split yellow gram)
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp ghee
 1 tsp freshly ground black pepper powder
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 chopped cashewnut (kaju) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Clean, wash and pressure cook the rice and moong dal along with salt, pepper and cumin seeds till soft and cooked.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Add the ghee and cashews and mix well.
Serve hot.
tags: Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Instant Masale Bhaat recipe - How to make Instant Masale Bhaat
ingredients:
3 cups cooked rice (chawal)
 1 tbsp ghee
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1 cup mixed chopped vegetables
 salt to taste
 chopped coriander (dhania) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the vegetables and remaining ingredients, mix well and saute for 10 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.
tags:
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
